Title: Two new species of green muscardine fungi from Japan
Keywords:
Metarhizium, entomopathogenic fungi, phylogenetic
analysis, pathogenicity, pigments
Abstract:
During the course of investigation on entomopathogenic
fungi in Japan, two new species of Metarhizium have been discovered. The
new species were recognized by molecular phylogenetic analyses of the
DNA sequences. The ex-type of M. bibionidae sp. nov. was isolated from a
larva of a march fly. This species was placed in the phylogeny as sister
species of M. pemphigi in the M. flavoviride species complex. The
conidia of this species were longer than those of M. pemphigi, which
supported the genetic independency of the two species. M. roseum sp.
nov. was isolated from soil by both plating method and bait method with
termites. The DNA sequence of this species was quite differentiated from
any known species of Metarhizium. Three isolates identified as this
species selectively produced red pigment when they were co-cultured with
the other fungal species.
